      31                 :            : /*!
      32                 :            :  * Grid map managing multiple overlaying maps holding float values.
      33                 :            :  * Data structure implemented as two-dimensional circular buffer so map
      34                 :            :  * can be moved efficiently.
      35                 :            :  *
      36                 :            :  * Data is defined with string keys. Examples are:
      37                 :            :  * - "elevation"
      38                 :            :  * - "variance"
      39                 :            :  * - "color"
      40                 :            :  * - "quality"
      41                 :            :  * - "surface_normal_x", "surface_normal_y", "surface_normal_z"
      42                 :            :  * etc.
      43                 :            :  */

     308                 :            :   /*!
     309                 :            :    * Apply isometric transformation (rotation + offset) to grid map and returns the transformed map.
     310                 :            :    * Note: The returned map may not have the same length since it's geometric description contains
     311                 :            :    * the original map.
     312                 :            :    * @param[in] transform the requested transformation to apply.
     313                 :            :    * @param[in] heightLayerName the height layer of the map.
     314                 :            :    * @param[in] newFrameId frame index of the new map.
     315                 :            :    * @param[in] sampleRatio if zero or negative, no in-painting is used to fill missing points due to sparsity of the map. Otherwise,
     316                 :            :    *            four points are sampled around each grid cell to make sure that at least one of those points map to a new grid cell.
     317                 :            :    *            A sampleRatio of 1 corresponds to the the resolution of the grid map.
     318                 :            :    * @return transformed map.
     319                 :            :    * @throw std::out_of_range if no map layer with name `heightLayerName` is present.
     320                 :            :    */
     321                 :            :   GridMap getTransformedMap(
     322                 :            :     const Eigen::Isometry3d & transform, const std::string & heightLayerName,
     323                 :            :     const std::string & newFrameId,
     324                 :            :     const double sampleRatio = 0.0) const;

     339                 :            :    * such that the grid map data is stationary in the grid map frame.

     475                 :            :    * Calculates the closest point to positionOutMap that is in the grid map.
     476                 :            :    * If positionOutMap is already in the grid map, that position is returned.
     477                 :            :    * @param[in] position position that should be approached as close as possible.
     478                 :            :    * @return position in map.
     479                 :            :    */
     480                 :            :   Position getClosestPositionInMap(const Position & position) const;

     488                 :            :   bool isValid(DataType value) const;

     500                 :            :    * @param nRows the number of rows to reset.
     501                 :            :    */
     502                 :            :   void clearRows(unsigned int index, unsigned int nRows);
     503                 :            : 
     504                 :            :   /*!
     505                 :            :    * Get cell data at requested position, linearly interpolated from 2x2 cells.
     506                 :            :    * @param layer the name of the layer to be accessed.
     507                 :            :    * @param position the requested position.
     508                 :            :    * @param value the data of the cell.
     509                 :            :    * @return true if linear interpolation was successful.
     510                 :            :    */
     511                 :            :   bool atPositionLinearInterpolated(
     512                 :            :     const std::string & layer, const Position & position,
     513                 :            :     float & value) const;
     514                 :            : 
     515                 :            : 
     516                 :            :   /*!
     517                 :            :    * Get cell data at requested position, cubic convolution
     518                 :            :    * interpolated from 4x4 cells. At the edge of the map,
     519                 :            :    * the algorithm assumes that height continues with the slope 0.
     520                 :            :    * I.e. the border cells just repeat outside of the map
     521                 :            :    * Taken from: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bicubic_interpolation
     522                 :            :    * @param[in] layer the name of the layer to be accessed.
     523                 :            :    * @param[in] position the requested position.
     524                 :            :    * @param[out] value the data of the cell.
     525                 :            :    * @return true if bicubic convolution interpolation was successful.
     526                 :            :    */
     527                 :            :   bool atPositionBicubicConvolutionInterpolated(
     528                 :            :     const std::string & layer, const Position & position,
     529                 :            :     float & value) const;
     530                 :            : 
     531                 :            :   /*!
     532                 :            :    * Get cell data at requested position, cubic interpolated
     533                 :            :    * on a square. At the edge of the map,
     534                 :            :    * the algorithm assumes that height continues with the slope 0.
     535                 :            :    * I.e. the border cells just repeat outside of the map
     536                 :            :    * Taken from: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bicubic_interpolation
     537                 :            :    * @param[in] layer the name of the layer to be accessed.
     538                 :            :    * @param[in] position the requested position.
     539                 :            :    * @param[out] value the data of the cell.
     540                 :            :    * @return true if bicubic interpolation was successful.
     541                 :            :    */
     542                 :            :   bool atPositionBicubicInterpolated(
     543                 :            :     const std::string & layer, const Position & position,
     544                 :            :     float & value) const;
     545                 :            : 
     546                 :            : 
     547                 :            :   /*!
     548                 :            :    * Resize the buffer.
     549                 :            :    * @param bufferSize the requested buffer size.
     550                 :            :    */
     551                 :            :   void resize(const Index & bufferSize);
     552                 :            : 
     553                 :            :   //! Frame id of the grid map.
     554                 :            :   std::string frameId_;
     555                 :            : 
     556                 :            :   //! Timestamp of the grid map (nanoseconds).
     557                 :            :   Time timestamp_;
     558                 :            : 
     559                 :            :   //! Grid map data stored as layers of matrices.
     560                 :            :   std::unordered_map<std::string, Matrix> data_;
     561                 :            : 
     562                 :            :   //! Names of the data layers.
     563                 :            :   std::vector<std::string> layers_;
     564                 :            : 
     565                 :            :   //! List of layers from `data_` that are the basic grid map layers.
     566                 :            :   //! This means that for a cell to be valid, all basic layers need to be valid.
     567                 :            :   //! Also, the basic layers are set to NAN when clearing the map with `clear()`.
     568                 :            :   std::vector<std::string> basicLayers_;
     569                 :            : 
     570                 :            :   //! Side length of the map in x- and y-direction [m].
     571                 :            :   Length length_;
     572                 :            : 
     573                 :            :   //! Map resolution in xy plane [m/cell].
     574                 :            :   double resolution_;
     575                 :            : 
     576                 :            :   //! Map position in the grid map frame [m].
     577                 :            :   Position position_;
     578                 :            : 
     579                 :            :   //! Size of the buffer (rows and cols of the data structure).
     580                 :            :   Size size_;
     581                 :            : 
     582                 :            :   //! Circular buffer start indeces.
     583                 :            :   Index startIndex_;
